Description:
Beautifully presented Family Entertainer on approx. 1.5 acres
Just minutes from Creswick you will find this beautiful home in a lovely setting with plenty of room to gather family & friends in complete comfort. The huge entertaining area on the east end a bonus to the front and rear veranda. Includes 3 Bedrooms plus study, en-suite & walk-in robe to master, 2 Living areas and masses of storage. North facing bay windows to formal lounge takes full advantage of the winter sun. Keep cosy with wood heating or split system. Easy care landscaped garden with vegie garden, chook shed and dam with jetty. Great shedding plus 4 bay carport. With fantastic views of Springmount, this family home has it all.
Insights: 2126 Midland Highway, Springmount VIC 3364 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
Daylesford District Former School House & School, Ideal B&B
Filled with character, oozing charm and offering a chance to celebrate its history, this delightful original school house lends itself beautifully to that sought after rural retreat or peaceful weekender for a couple or an opportunity to maintain its current operation as the School House Bed & Breakfast.
High timber ceilings and original polished floor boards set the scene for this classic weatherboard home in Kooroocheang. Shadowed by the school building, this home is just 20 minutes from Daylesford and/or Creswick, in the gorgeous farming community, with sweeping country side adding to its unique appeal and lifestyle.
Warmed by a freestanding combustion heater and providing an Early Kooka oven, this homely hub is bursting with character while offering a cosy place to entertain friends and family. One bedroom is available with a timber over mantel, while walls, floors, ceilings and doors celebrate the 1870s architecture in which the home was built.
The country style lounge with wood heater has large french style doors which open onto the rear private deck and enchanting view through the landscaped garden surrounds.
Pressed metal splash backs are combined with a double vintage concrete wash trough, a gorgeous peep window and a second toilet in the laundry, while the very generous and uplifted bathroom provides an original pedestal bath, double shower, vanity and handy inside toilet. The bathroom can be easily converted back to 2nd bedroom and bathroom incorporated in the laundry.
The separate school is in original condition and lends itself to further development to incorporate into the house as extra living or bedroom space. The old blackboards and school cupboards remain a feature as does the high hall ceiling.
Entwined with vines and offering rambling organic gardens, this one acre property will encourage a weekend away, while delivering a toasty abode to raise a glass or two.
Connected to tank water and offering a brand new hot water service, this home with its quaint veranda is well positioned in the popular Daylesford district and offers a restful, charming home, filled with fascination and inspiration.
For further details regarding the original school house, please contact our agent today.

Description:
A Piece of Creswick History With Many Options
This charismatic property on Creswick's main road is sure to create a stir. For many years it has been the home of antique store and more recently a studio apartment. The shop fronted construction has three studio areas for the operation of a business. These rooms are spacious and perfect for your business. Amazing passing traffic will also be ideal. The rear of the dwelling is currently utilised as living with dining, lounge and bedrooms zones. The new kitchen is attractive and far more functional than the original. It is open plan to the dining & lounge. The bathroom has also seen recent renovation and with other modern comforts such as a gas log fire and two reverse air-conditioners the abode is very comfortable. A large rear yard with street access hold great car coverage and a workshop measuring roughly 5x10 meters.
Insights: 32 Albert Street, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2017.

FAMILY HOME WITH SPACE AND PRIVACY, YET CLOSE TO TOWN

Internal features include good-sized living area, kitchen with dishwasher & meals area, four large bedrooms all with BIR's, separate bath & shower, plus the massive bonus of both gas central heating and cooling throughout the home. Externally on the approx 821 sqm block that has side and rear access. Utilise two separate & private rear yards, 9m x 7m garage plus extra shedding all overlooking a scenic backdrop of the area.

Description:
RENOVATED HOME, ACRES, SERENITY AND MINIMAL BILLS
In an elevated position overlooking Talbot and moments from the town centre, is this impressive renovated three bedroom, two bathroom weatherboard home. On 13 acres (approx.) of mostly cleared, fully fenced land, this would be the perfect property for the horse lover or a family requiring extra space and privacy. This spacious home features a substantial open plan living/dining area with stunning bamboo flooring, Jindarra wood heater, split system, great natural light, all complete with its own plumbed bar. Three bedrooms all with BIRs and main with renovated ensuite and air conditioning. Neat and practical kitchen with gas cooking and large corner pantry. Minimise your bills with 80,000 litres (approx.) of tank water and 4.2 KW of solar power to the grid. The large front and back verandas are great for entertaining and relaxing. Loads of shedding, including a four car drive through lock-up garage and double carport. Two dams, a chook pen and loads of room to explore. Don't let this one pass you by and arrange a viewing today!
Contact Alisa Johnson at our Maryborough office on 0409935766.
Alisa Johnson : 0409 935 766
Insights: 45 Gladstone Street, Talbot VIC 3371 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
THREE BEDROOM MUD BRICK HOUSE - 12 ACRES (approx) - 2 DAMS
This substantial home,(yes to mains power, large tanks and good shed) is constructed from mud bricks and has a most striking interior. Walls have been painted in a light-enhancing cream which combines beautifully with timber beams and doors. The spacious open plan living area (wood fire heater) is enhanced by the lofty straw and timber ceilings and emphasised by the upright bush posts. A dining area is adjacent to the fresh, updated kitchen - clean lines, tiled floor/ splash-back, plus generous storage and a stainless steel oven. The living area has been carpeted (as new). Three double bedrooms offer excellent accommodation and the tiled bathroom houses vanity, toilet and deep, claw-foot bath with over-head shower (built in 'step-up' for comfort). Laundry fixtures are also incorporated into the bathroom. Outside there are broad verandas front (decked) and back; 13 x 3.5 caravan/carport; 9m x 7m garage with workshop; 3 tanks (approx 100,000 litres). There are 2 dams - the major one with good catchment providing water to the gardens and there is a solar hot water service. This property would be a delight for anyone with horses as well as the sheer enjoyment of a rural lifestyle. It is located 10 minutes from Talbot (outstanding Farmers Market every 3rd Sunday) and 20 minutes from Maryborough; Paddy's Ranges (State Forest) is at the back door. Inspections invited.

Renovated bathroom with shower WC and vanity. Fully fenced, 2nd WC outside, single garage with tilt door, old shed and exterior laundry with extra shower. Does this sound like it could be the one!!

Description:
SPACIOUS HOME & GRANNY FLAT ON A GENEROUS BLOCK IN POPULAR CRESWICK
Located only a short distance from the centre of ever popular Creswick is this lovely home on a substantial allotment with three entries. Offering privacy and good set back from the road this home Is nestled amongst attractive gardens. The home features three generous sized bedrooms all with BIR's. There is a large open plan kitchen, meals and living area with the designer kitchen having been fully renovated and offering quality appliances and a dishwasher. The home enjoys gas heating as well as air conditioning. Adjacent to the home is a single bedroom fully self-contained granny flat which is very comfortable and also has a split system for heating and cooling a seperate entrance & car space. Outside is a range of useful shedding as well as horse stables and a great paddock. A beautiful property is a highly sought after location. A must to inspect.
Allister Morrison

Description:
Immaculate Hobby Farm On 10 Acres
Presented with absolute pride, this single level ranch design with grand brick fence and entrance offers a large circular driveway with raised centre garden, sweeping lawns, picturesque bridge, fishpond and a general park like feel. Set on a approximately 10 acres which offers room for horse enthusiasts, motorbike riders or those just looking for room to move. Suitable for grazing a number of animals with ample water from the bore, a small pine shelter, along with fences encompassing the home?s allotment.
Built during the 90?s by JG King, this well insulated home with front and back verandas still holds designs and décor extravagances for today?s living. Tastefully appointed with; chandelier lighting through the three bedrooms, a galley style kitchen, formal and informal dining zones, a built in bar in the lounge room along with an overall spacious effect throughout. The master suite boasts built in robes and a large en- suite while a fully self-contained teenagers retreat to the rear creates an additional space for guests, and family members. The family bathroom is positioned perfectly to the other bedrooms with a separate toilet and independent laundry adding to the hygiene level of the home.
A number of sheds offer room for vehicle and machinery cover while one shed has been installed with industrial power (2 phase) which is metered separately for checking power usage. A garden shed and water tanks also provide storage room and generous water catchment, while the huge enclosed vegetable garden, prolific fruit trees and chicken runs help create self-sufficient living benefits. An outdoor rotunda also gives style to dining under the stars while taking in the tranquillity of the property. Located in the popular Australasia Mine area on Berry Mine Lane, this property is definitely worth your inspection.

Description:
Fancy A 5 Acre Allotment Getaway OR Weekender
This private sanctuary is just five minutes to Creswick and 20 minutes to Daylesford. The modern construction is designed to give great comfort. A vast open plan kitchen, meals and lounge is downstairs and made ever so cosy with combustion heating. There is also a sunroom that does capture morning and lunchtime sun. Upstairs is an enormous master bedroom-parents retreat. This room also has space for a study or could be divided into two large rooms. The bathroom come semi-ensuite is also upstairs. The occupier can enjoy the balcony overlooking the bushland and clear paddocks of neighbouring properties. There is good shedding, 30,000 litres of tank water and a 3.2 solar 24 volt system with brand new BAE - lead acid gel batteries. So if you seek a tranquil setting, bird & wildlife and a peace & quiet, this setting is for you.

Description:
Spacious country home, with all the conveniences of town
A spacious home on a generous 2 acre allotment, located at the edge of the vibrant town of Creswick. Full of character and designed for easy family living, this home is ideal for the growing family who wants space to play or those who simply want some peace and privacy.
The fully renovated kitchen is the heart of the home. With gas appliances, ample storage and bench space, and a unique charm it's easy to feel at home. The open plan layout connects the kitchen to the dining room and a large living room featuring floor to ceiling windows that look out onto the private leafy gardens. A second living room or rumpus room features a bar and built in bookshelves – an ideal retreat for the adults.
The master bedroom features an ensuite and built in robes. At the other end of the house there are two large bedrooms, both with built in robes and a smaller single bedroom or study. The updated family bathroom has a separate shower and bath. The laundry has ample space to leave your boots and coats.
The home is kept warm with a powerful thermostat-controlled gas log fire, a new gas heater near the bedrooms and an electric heater in the bathroom. A ceiling fan and cross drafts from the screen covered windows keeps the house cool in summer.
A double carport sits near the house and a double garage with concrete floor and additional storage provides all the space you need to store your tools and big toys. A green house and chicken coup provide the potential for many outdoor pursuits. There is a delightful vine-covered patio for entertaining on the east side and an enchanting garden path leading to a fireplace on the west side. There is so much space to entertain family and friends! The land is fully fenced and a smaller yard to keep pets and children safe is attached to the house.
Gas, electricity, water and cabled NBN are all connected to the house, giving you all the convenience of city living, within the peaceful surrounds of the country. All this while being just a few minutes from Creswick, 15 minutes from Wendouree and 20 minutes from central Ballarat.
Send a message to make an appointment soon, this property won't last long!
Insights: 150 Ascot Road, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2017 and 14 other 4 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
Magnificient 233 acres with stunning views
With highly productive soils and elevated sections providing sweeping views of rich volcanic plains and Hepburn Lagoon, this 233 acre property is simply stunning.
Superbly located with easy access and proximity to Ballarat (approx. 25 min) and Daylesford and Creswick (approx. 10-15 min), this property is currently a mixed farming/cattle operation but has the potential, with the addition of a dwelling at one of many potential sites, to be the ultimate lifestyle property.
This gently undulating country rises up the western side of Kangaroo Hills and has a solidly-based central laneway system which not only allows for convenient stock movement, but also has the potential to be developed into a driveway for a home site (STCA).
The property is divided into 10 main paddocks and 2 smaller holding paddocks; fencing is in excellent condition throughout and includes a network of electric fencing (energizer included).
There is an excellent water supply with four catchment dams and 2 bores. Water is gravity fed from a poly tank to a network of troughs. Power is connected directly beside a recently sunk bore which requires a pump and easy connection to the existing system of laid pipes (currently water is pumped through the system of pipes from a bore across the road).
The property has an excellent set of steel cattleyards (including a crush and loading ramp) and a serviceable 3 bay shed. It is very well sheltered courtesy of various plantations and shelterbelts.
10% Deposit
Settlement: 1st March 2017
For inspection and further details contact agent.
Insights: Blampied VIC 3364 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
Luxury Living in the Goldfields Resort - Bring Your Clubs!
This stunning residence may well be the most spacious and private home to ever hit the market in this golf course estate. Set in a quiet court at the front of the estate the home boasts lovely course, tree top and wildlife views. The high set abode delivers with large bedrooms, vast living rooms and great entertaining areas. The master takes your king size suite, has a walk-in-robe and ensuite with twin shower & vanity. The spare bedrooms are also generous and have built-in-robes. A stunning kitchen with granite benchtops and stainless steel appliances is also open plan to the formal living and dining area. Lovely views are had with floor to ceiling windows. There is a fantastic rumpus room away from formal zones which is ideal for the billiard table or theatre room. Heating and cooling are amply supplied for all year comfort. Rare for the estate is an enclosed private yard with delightful gardens, decking and lounging areas. Of course all occupiers can enjoy the lifestyle of daily golf, bush walks, mountain bike tracks and restaurant & bar at the 19th hole just a 2 minute stroll away. Two minutes to Creswick, ten to Ballarat, 25 to Daylesford and one hour to Melbourne. The home could also be a wonderful weekender.

Description:
THINK: PRETTY COUNTRY SPOT - 6.5 ACRES (approx) WITH WEEKEND ACCOM.
This tranquil country allotment, with weekend accommodation, is reminiscent of a favourite picnic area - this one has irregular boundaries with a seasonal creek and dam. The basic little dwelling consists of one large room (timber flooring) with designated sleeping and cooking zones (small gas stove - 2 burners and oven) plus a shower alcove. It is warmed by the wood fire heater and power from solar panels provide light and a ceiling fan. There is tank water, a small storage shed and a garden tools shed. An old caravan is adjacent.
The property is ideal for weekend enjoyment with no cares. Seriously, not just another pretty spot.

Description:
Price Reduced - Vendor Says Sell!!
The entrepreneurial spirit isn't something you are taught, it's something you must develop within yourself; are you a person who can organise and manage - a person with drive? This is what you can achieve with this amazing slice of land, smack bang in the middle of the thriving township of Creswick. Previously marked and approved for an 18 lot subdivision, this generous allotment?s permit has now lapsed, and may be more ideally suited for a number of inner town allotments with all services available.
This block is walking distance to shops, hospital, sporting facilities, schools and public transport with a short 15 minute drive into Ballarat. Set on approx. 2.76 acres or 11,000sqm with access from Clunes Road and/or Little King Street, it certainly tantalizes ones? entrepreneurial thoughts. With an appealing outlook over Creswick Creek, this large flat allotment provides further features with nature?s sheer pleasure of large established trees and shrubs framing its border. Whether it is this grand opportunity to subdivide or whether it is your ideal block for building your dream home to enjoy having some room around you, this inner town acreage is a must to inspect. Take the first step and initiative; call our agents today.

Description:
Country Cottage Charm
Located just 15 minutes to Daylesford and 10 minutes to Creswick, this light and bright original Cobb & Co Coach cottage has been renovated and is well presented. Set on 3727m2 of private land overlooking open farmland with a creek boundary. Offering 3 good sized bedrooms, 2 living areas, full laundry, central bathroom, central kitchen with meals area and sunroom. Well thought-out and established gardens with a double carport and garden shed.
-Telephone line& NBN fast internet connections available
-Services include: mains power, town water and septic system
-2 x wood combustion heaters & split system heating cooling
-Outdoor entertaining alfresco area
Inspections are offered by private appointment and recommended.

Description:
Former Smeaton Primary School circa 1910
An opportunity for the lover of heritage buildings and gardens to create a landmark property of the calibre of Musk Farm. Presenting as a fantastic opportunity to capitalise on the charm and endless character of a bygone era and transform into a beautiful home (STCA). Enjoy sweeping rural views & easy proximity to amenities, approximately 32kms north of Ballarat, 15kms north east of Creswick and 23kms west of Daylesford.
Stunning triple brick, heritage property
340.6m2 of accommodation, polished boards, soaring ceilings & gas heating
Magnificent total land size 1.012 hectares benefiting from three road frontages, allows scope for full renovation/landscaping and extension of current school house along with further development (STCA)
The two Certificates of Title, being Volume 2610 Folio 833 (8 lots) and Volume 2486 Folio 072 (2 lots)
Consider the opportunity for the separate on-sale of the existing lots, subject to appropriate servicing arrangements. Prospective purchasers should make their own enquiries concerning this opportunity
Asphalt paved tennis court
Numerous structural improvements including craft room (extension built 1963), pergola, 2 x toilet blocks, 2 x garden sheds, fernery and bicycle shelter
For garden lovers, tranquil country vistas and rich volcanic soils
Reticulated town water plus four water tanks with an aggregate capacity of approximately 100,000 litres
Septic tank connected
Zoning: Township, Hepburn Planning Scheme. Overlay control: Environmental Significance Overlay. Heritage Overlay Schedule (HO781). Designated Bushfire Prone Area
